title: the foreign member of the Königliche Böhmische Gesellschaft der Wissenschaften in Prague in 1793 and a few years later as canon of Stifts Walbeck by the king of Prussia. After the duke’s death in 1804, Zach left Gotha to accompany the duke’s widow, Marie Charlotte Amalie, to live in France and Italy until her death in 1827. He conducted further surveys in this period and determined fixed-point networks, such as in Florence. He helped with the construction of astronomic observatories in Naples and Lucca and supplemented the sun tables and designed a star index with aberration and nutation tables. He spent his last years in illness with his physician, Jean Civiale
